intro: Psychotria leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns from green to yellow or red as it matures. Psychotria leucocarpa is often found in shaded, moist environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
